meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! Get ready for some serious RPG-ing and snarky commentary from yours truly. Today, I'm diving into Wizardry: Proving Grounds of the Mad Overlord, a remake of a classic 1981 dungeon crawler that's sure to test your mettle (and patience).

First off, let me just say that the developers at Digital Eclipse have done an impressive job of honoring the original game while still bringing it up to speed for modern gamers. The graphics may not be cutting-edge, but they're retro-cool in a way that'll make you nostalgic for the good ol' days of pixel art.

Now, onto the gameplay! You know those critics who say it's "punishing" and "challenging"? Yeah, they're right. This game is like trying to solve a Rubik's Cube blindfolded while being attacked by a swarm of bees (just kidding... or am I?). But in all seriousness, Wizardry requires strategy, planning, and a healthy dose of perseverance.

Some critics have called it "too hard" for modern audiences, and I'm inclined to agree. If you're not used to grinding through tough battles and making tactical decisions on the fly, this game might be more frustrating than fun. On the other hand, if you're an RPG veteran looking for a challenge that'll put your skills to the test, Wizardry is the perfect fix.

One thing I will say is that the character customization could use some work. Don't get me wrong â€“ it's nice to have some options, but when you're stuck with the same old spells and abilities for the whole game, it can feel a bit limited. Maybe that's just me being a casual gamer who likes a little more variety in their RPGs.

All in all, Wizardry: Proving Grounds of the Mad Overlord is a solid choice for fans of old-school RPGs and those looking for a serious challenge. Just don't say I didn't warn you...
